greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Decimal expansion of the prime zeta modulo function at 4 for primes of the form 4k+3.
link: P. Flajolet and I. Vardi, Zeta Function Expansions of Classical Constants, Unpublished manuscript. 1996.
X. Gourdon and P. Sebah, Some Constants from Number theory.
R. J. Mathar, Table of ... Prime Zeta Modulo functions..., arXiv:1008.2547 [math.NT], 2010-2015, value P(m=4, n=3, s=4), page 21.
OEIS index to entries related to the (prime) zeta function.
formula: where b(x) = (1-2^(-x))*zeta(x)/L(x) and L(x) is the Dirichlet Beta function.
mathematica: b[x_] = (1 - 2^(-x))*(Zeta[x]/DirichletBeta[x]); $MaxExtraPrecision = 200; m = 40; Prepend[ RealDigits[ (1/2)*NSum[ MoebiusMu[2n+1]* Log[b[(2n+1)*4]]/(2n+1), {n, 0, m}, AccuracyGoal -> 120, NSumTerms -> m, PrecisionGoal -> 120, WorkingPrecision -> 120] ][[1]], 0][[1 ;; 105]] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jun 22 2011, updated Mar 14 2018 *)
program: A085993_upto(N=100)={localprec(N+3); digits((PrimeZeta43(4)+1)\.1^N)[^1]} \\ see A085991 for the PrimeZeta43 function. - _M. F. Hasler_, Apr 25 2021
xref: Cf. A086034 (analog for primes 4k+1), A085964 (PrimeZeta(4)), A002145 (primes 4k+3).
results.author: Antonio G. Astudillo (afg_astudillo(AT)lycos.com), Jul 06 2003
